intro: Anistylis convallaria, commonly known as sweet grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender, erect stems covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow, grass-like, and often have a slight sheen, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Anistylis convallaria is often used in floral arrangements and has a mild, sweet fragrance that becomes more pronounced when dried.
